ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] OT - duel info needed
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess evade just lowers you on the hatelist, but doesn t remove you. Then again, skellies aggro on pretty much everyone as long as they are close. Perhaps in
ygData.messageBody:
I guess evade just lowers you on the hatelist, but doesn't remove you. Then
again, skellies aggro on pretty much everyone as long as they are close.

Perhaps in this situation, you should resort to taunting her (not the
skill, just talking trash) and hope that she is so distracted by that it
gives you enough time for the immobilize to wear off. Role playing opens up
a lot of different possibilities. Or you could go the pity approach if one
of the high level Kithicor denizens is nearby and get something big to
attack you, requiring her to save you so you can possibly run away.

You have nothing to lose in trying. :-)

---Windleaf

At 01:46 PM 11/15/00 -0500, JESSICA_WEBBER@... wrote:

>Thanks for the prompt reply, Talies. This started with me stealing from a
>third player. The Wizard jumped in and , after making her chase me to
>Kithicore, I more or less conceded defeat. But the wizard didn't want to
>end the game yet so she accused me of stealing from her too. It's all in
>the name of fun and she's been VERY sportsmanlike about bending the rules
>of EQ to allow a few of my moves.
>
>I think I'll shoot the arrow at the skeleton just before Immobilize wears
>off. Then run for the zone. If she allows the move, the skeleton will
>eventually fall back and forget about me, but it will be in her path as she
>chases me. I'm counting on the stuns, cause she's got Jboots and I don't.
>
>Peace
>Evulia, bard of 13 tunes
>Mead, agitator of high level casters
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Talies the
> Wanderer To: eqbards@egroups.com
> <snicker@pink cc:
> pig.com> Subject: Re: [eqbards] OT
> - duel info needed
> 11/15/2000
> 01:16 PM
> Please
> respond to
> eqbards
>
>
>
>
>
>
>At 12:07 PM 11/15/00 -0500, you wrote:
> >Sorry this is off topic, but I know this is an active list and need a
>quick
> >answer.
> >
> >My level 14 rogue is engaged in a virtual duel via email with a level 45
> >wizard. She's not out to kill me, just to get an item back. Currently
>I'm
> >immobilized and she's sitting a little ways in front of me medding.
> >
> >My thought was to shoot an arrow and a skeleton that just spawned behind
> >her, then evade and hope that it would attack the medding 45 wizard in
>it's
> >path before continuing on to me. (I want it to stun her so I can flee
> >before she gets another root off)
> >
> >What are the chances something like this would work in-game?
>
>
>Probably not, since in order for a monster to switch targets, it needs to
>have distance issues. If you can't move farther from the wizard, that
>skelly will just ignore her and move on to you.
>
>FYI 14 vs 45 - just give her the darn thing back.
>
>Talies
>
>
>
>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
>with the subject submissions.
>
>
>

>
